revised_title: Comparing the French Metre with the English Standard
tldr: The author compares the French metre with the English standard using two metres from Paris. They found that the length of the French metre a bouts is 39.37081 inches, and the length of the French metre a traits is 39.37076 inches. The mean of these measurements is 39.37079 inches, which can be taken as the length of the metre in inches of Sir G. Shuckburgh's standard scale when each is brought to its proper temperature.
